Case reference: 2006013099.CaseDesc: On June 22, 2003, an unidentified man was discovered in the Ottawa River, near Petrie Island, in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020054.CaseDesc: Glenn Colombe was last seen by his parents on June 28, 1989. At this time, he indicated to his parents he had a sore head which he said was the result of a fight he had been in earlier in the evening. He has not been seen since.

Hat: Cotton, White, philly flyers ball cap

Case reference: 2016068154.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from Gough Creek at the east end of Queen Street, in Kapuskasing. This area is known to have been used by vagrants and others as a place for consuming alcohol. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 10 days prior to discovery.

Teeth: Several of his teeth are missing and he has cavities

Case reference: 2012020087.CaseDesc: James Carlson was last seen between 7:00 p.m. and 8:00 p.m. at a local business in Watrous, SK. On May 5, 2010, Mr. Carlson's 1985 Chevrolet Monte Carlo was found in a rural area south of Rosthern. Police have not located Mr. Carlson.

Hair: Brown, Balding in front , longer in back

Case reference: 2018055666.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1991, Kristina Rhodes was seen for the last time in Port Elgin, Ontario. Kristina was also known to frequent the towns of Southampton and Hanover, Ontario.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014001487.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Raymond Snakeskin was last seen in Wollaston Lake, SK. He had told another individual that he was making a pilgrimage to Zangeza Bay on Reindeer Lake, approximately 60 kilometers through the bush. Mr. Snakeskin has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017040839.CaseDesc: Claude Lévesque was last seen on July 17, 2017, in the Mercier/Hochelaga-Maisonneuve sector of Montreal. He had an appointment with his Doctor that afternoon, yet he never showed up. He is known to be despondent.

Scar: Right Forearm, Front of arm, wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014002675.CaseDesc: Richard Monroe was last seen on October 2nd, 2001 by the owners of Serge's Restaurant on Elgin Street in the city of Greater Sudbury. Richard is believed to have suffered from dementia. He spent most of his time in Thessalon, Sault Ste. Marie, Dunn's Valley, Sudbury and British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003985.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1974 Randall Crighton was seen for the last time in Richmond, British Columbia. He was involved in a motor vehicle accident with a friend who had left the scene. Randall has not been seen or heard from since. Randall had substance abuse problems and may have been despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2020017934.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Lebohang Nicol was seen for the last time in the area of 600 University Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Lebohang is also known to go by the first name of “Toby.” He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001691.CaseDesc: Norman Krolman was last seen withdrawing money from an ATM machine.  He was a self-employed computer programmer and was in business with a partner.  He had a steady girlfriend and a small circle of friends.

Case reference: 2014002008.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1999, Pierre Bédard was seen for the last time while he left his home in Levis, Quebec. Mr. Bédard’s vehicle was located at Anse Benson in the St- Romuald neighbourhood in Levis.

Case reference: 2016065871.CaseDesc:
On May 10, 1973, a male, approximately 170 lbs., 5'6"-5'8" in height, robbed the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce on Main Street South in Kenora. He was subsequently shot by police upon getaway which detonated the explosive device that was carried on his body. 
It was later determined that this individual had spent 2 days at the hotel between April 23 and 25, checking-in under the name of "Paul Higgins, 435 Glen Dr., Toronto". Upon check-out, he apparently took a bus to Winnipeg but arranged to have his steamer trunk stored at the hotel. He checked back into the hotel on May 5. The steamer trunk was found in his room following the robbery along with items that were disposed of by the Armed Forces Demolition Unit. The remains of Old Port, Dutch Prince and Teuros-Havanas cigars and cigar packages were also found in his room. The name and address that this individual provided upon check-in were followed-up with negative results.

Boots: Size 10 Chippewa bush boots with 1" thick insole

Case reference: 2014001072.CaseDesc: On July 19 1984, the body of a male believed to be between the ages of 18-29 was found in the waters of the Fraser River near Boston Bar, British Columbia. He had some crowding on his upper teeth and no tattoos or obvious scars. It is believed he was deceased for a few months prior to his remains being recovered.

Case reference: 2014005263.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2007, Annie Proulx was seen for the last time in the Rimouski area in Quebec. Annie has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Rose, Heart and Bulldog

Case reference: 2022047182.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2022, Rebecca Hearty was seen for the last time in Newmarket, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Rebecca was living a transient lifestyle, and is known to frequent the Greater Toronto Area. She also has ties to British Columbia and Manitoba.

Case reference: 2008009598.CaseDesc: Mario Palermo was reported missing on January 20, 1978, by his mother. At that time, Mr. Palermo was living at home and was single. The last contact family members had with him was on January 8, 1978 when his mother received a Grey Coach parcel sent from Orillia which contained a pair of boots that he had borrowed from his brother and two boxes of chocolates.

Case reference: 2014005915.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2012, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Frank Fuernkranz was seen for the last time on vacation in Panama. Frank had left to go for a walk, but never returned.

Case reference: 2019016881.CaseDesc: On March 15, 2019, Emilio Montéus was seen for the last time in the borough of Montréal-Nord, Quebec. He ceased contact and we have not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014003388.CaseDesc: Janet Henry was a resident of Vancouver's downtown east side; she struggled with mental health and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Despite her challenges, Ms. Henry kept in frequent contact with her family. She was last seen on June 25, 1997, and was reported missing two days later.

Case reference: 2014004932.CaseDesc: Mathieu Daneau's disappearance occurred on April 3, 2007 in the region of St-Hyacinthe, Quebec. Mr. Daneau was admitted for treatment at the L'Envolée center. He left the center and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005122.CaseDesc: Phillip Morin was last seen in the Colony Street area. Mr. Morin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2018053566.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1995, at approximately 8:30am, Robert Walmsley was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Robert was scheduled to meet with his sister the following day, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2006025499.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1976, Anthony Malinak and friends arrived at Long Lake and fished during the day. That evening Mr. Malinak had taken a boat from Mountain Lodge on Long Lake. The boat was found at the east end of the lake in a foot of water.  Mr. Malinak's rain jacket and hat were found in the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005573.CaseDesc: In November/December 1976, Vernon Loiselle was visiting family in an Edmonton, Alberta hospital. Vernon left the hospital and hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2014001190.CaseDesc: In June, 1997, the body of a male was found floating in Malpeque Harbour, Prince Edward Island. The man was buried without ever having been identified. In 2010 the remains were exhumed so that a facial approximation could be completed by a forensic artist. Subsequent media publicity has failed to identify the man. His physical descriptors do not match missing persons from the Atlantic Canada region.

Case reference: 2014001146.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1974, the  remains of an adult male were found near Union Bar Road in Hope, British Columbia. He was 30-49 years old, had five simple dental restorations on the lower teeth and it is believed that he would have gone missing two to twenty years before his remains were located.

Case reference: 2020035556.CaseDesc: On the night of August 31, 2020, Cory Westcott was seen for the last time in Bonnington, located approximately 10 minutes outside of Nelson, British Columbia. Cory was reported missing to the Nelson Police Department on September 4, 2020.

Teeth: Gold crown on upper front left tooth
Backpack: Other, Multi-coloured side bag, Supreme brand
Tattoo: Neck, Unknown tattoo across front of neck

Case reference: 2014005794.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2012 at 11 p.m., Pierre Desjardins left his residence in Notre-Dame-de-Lourdes, Quebec on foot and has not been seen since. Pierre was known to live a transient lifestyle and had made suicidal comments in the past.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Castle with a dragon on the bicep

Case reference: 2005006799.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1978, an unidentified woman was discovered in an area of bush on the Chudleigh’s Farm in Milton, Ontario.

Teeth: Other, Had been edentulous for many years prior to her death.

Case reference: 2014002449.CaseDesc: On July 27, 1997, Mike Tsannie was last seen traveling by boat across Wollaston Lake, SK. Mr. Tsannie’s boat was later found unoccupied, and searches failed to locate any trace of him.

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2014002416.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1983, Desmond Runstedler was believed to be travelling to Ontario and was last seen standing on the side of Highway #13 near Lougheed, AB.  His personal items were left at his residence.

Case reference: 2019072428.CaseDesc: In April of 2019, Corey Baldwin was seen for the last time in Ottawa, Ontario. It is out of character for Corey not to contact his father for an extended period of time. It is possible that Corey may be in British Columbia or Montreal, Quebec.

Tattoo: Middle Back, Dragon on entire back
Left Arm, Sleeve with a graffiti wreath
Right Arm, Cartoon wolf with a police hat
Right Arm, A full sleeve to the elbow
Left Upper Arm, Inside left bicep written "I love her"
Scar: Chest, 2-3 Inches, a horizontal deep scar on the sternum
Lower Back, Surgical scar, horseshoe shape on the tailbone

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019029100.CaseDesc: Robert Allen Wetsch was reported missing by family on May 19, 2019. There have not been any confirmed sightings of him since.

Case reference: 2013000058.CaseDesc: Marie-Berthe Perreault Astle Wiseman has been missing since June 26th 1975. She was last seen in her home located in the suburb of Pointe-Claire in Montreal, Quebec before mysteriously disappearring.

Case reference: 2014003528.CaseDesc: Mrs. Huyghe was reported missing after she had not returned home. Police investigations regarding Mrs. Huyghe are ongoing and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Boots: Leather, Black, winter boot with suede fur tops
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, family ring with colored stone

Case reference: 2007004799.CaseDesc: Stacy Dilenardi was last seen on November 28, 2005, purchasing some cigarettes at a gas bar in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario (Garden River). He had just moved to Sault Ste. Marie and had recently started a job as a technician with the Ontario Forest Research Institute. Stacy had spoken to his father the day before his disappearance. On November 30, 2005, investigators located his vehicle north of the city on a snowmobile trail.

Case reference: 2014006264.CaseDesc: William (Bill) Kwiatek was last seen in Canmore, AB, in July, 1988. He was leaving a bar and was intending to hitchhike back to Calgary but never made it there. Mr. Kwiatek was reported missing in 2013 and very few details of when he was last seen are known.

Amputation: Left Ring Finger, partial missing finger

Case reference: 2014003070.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1996, Yolande Trudeau Laberge was seen for the last time near the Larocque Bridge in Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, Quebec. Yolande has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Arm, Under arm, approximately 1 inch

Case reference: 2014004976.CaseDesc: Beric Bason was last seen on July 22, 2007 at Loon Lake Resort near Clinton, British Columbia.  Beric has not been seen or heard from since and the reason for his disappearance is unknown.

Case reference: 2012020032.CaseDesc: Lorilee Francis was last known to be in Grande Prairie, Alberta. She has not been heard from by family or friends since approximately October of 2007.

Case reference: 2018054598.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 2018, Dwayne Lavallee was seen for the last time in his vehicle leaving the Ebb and Flow First Nation community and the vehicle was located on September 26th, north of the community of Ste. Rose du Lac, Manitoba.

Jacket: Black, Yellow, Work jacket with reflective stripes

Case reference: 2006017499.CaseDesc: Michael McIntyre was last seen on April 7, 1994 at his home on Round Lake in Hagarty Township, approximately 10 km northwest of Killaloe, On. An extensive land search and follow up to leads have proved negative. Mr. McIntyre is formerly from Fort McMurray, Alberta. He came to live in Round Lake in December of 1993. He is an avid outdoor sportsman.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2014004950.CaseDesc: On June 5, 2007, Kim Rogelstad was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Kim's family has not seen or heard from her since May 27, 2007.

Case reference: 2014006991.CaseDesc: Maxime Perreault was living alone and in an isolated area in the municipality of East Bolton and was working in the municipality of Eastman, in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec. On April 28, 2014, Maxime contacted his family and friends stating that he would visit them around May 3, 2014 in Beloeil, Quebec. He never arrived. He usually travels on foot, by bike, by bus or hitchhiking with a navy blue backpack.

Case reference: 2012020073.CaseDesc: On February 20, 2004, at approximately 11:45 p.m., Sunshine Wood was seen for the last time in front of the St. Regis Hotel, situated on 285 Smith Street, in Winnipeg, Manitoba. That night, Sunshine had been socializing with a number of the hotel’s patrons in front of the hotel. During the time of her disappearance, Sunshine was enrolled at the Gordon Bell High School, and is not known to be a runaway. Her disappearance is out of character.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Image of a heart
Left Hand, Unknown tattoo on all fingers

Case reference: 2014005526.CaseDesc: Angela Meyer went missing from her parents’ residence. She was on a weekend pass from Stanton Territorial Hospital and under the legal guardianship of her mother. Miss Meyer had gone outside of the residence for a cigarette and has not been seen since. There were sightings of her walking in the Con Mine area.  She was taking various medications and did not take the medications with her when she went missing.

Jacket: Nylon, Red, Black, Hip length, black on the back of sleeves

Case reference: 2013000012.CaseDesc: Cameron March was last seen by his mother on May 7, 1975, at approximately 3:15 p.m. He was playing on a swing set in a next door neighbour's yard located on Blind Line in the City of Burlington, Ontario. Cameron followed the adult neighbour into the residence and asked to play with a friend. When told the friend was sleeping, Cameron left the residence, walking towards his house.

Teeth: Braces, Braces on lower left side of teeth.  One top tooth discolored.
Shirt: White, T-shirt with green band around collar. Brown and green monkeys climbing on front.

Case reference: 2010001799.CaseDesc: On the morning of May 18, 1993, Christine Harron stayed home from school as she was not feeling well. Around lunch time Christine and her mother argued about Christine returning to school for the afternoon. Her mother heard Christine leave the house at about 1:30 pm. Christine did not attend school that afternoon and she has not been seen since. The investigation revealed that Christine left the house without her purse, money or knapsack. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Christine Harron, however her remains have yet to be located.

Glasses: Plastic, Brown, Large rimmed with tape

Case reference: 2014003161.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1985, Andrew Pasztor was reported missing in Richmond, British Columbia.  Andrew had left home with the family vehicle which was later found at a restaurant in North Vancouver.  Andrew has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Beige, Vinyl with imitation fur collar

Case reference: 2006002799.CaseDesc: On September 2, 1996, a Caucasian male was found near the railway tracks at 888 Dupont Street near Ossington Avenue in Toronto. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 195 lbs however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Case reference: 2006010099.CaseDesc: David Stevens was last seen June 14, 1979, in a canoe on the Ogoki River, approximately 70 km north of Armstrong. He was believed to be going towards Whitewater Lake. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. Stevens.

Case reference: 2006012399.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, an unidentified man was discovered in the Ottawa River, near the Ottawa Rowing Club, in Ottawa, Ontario.

Shirt: Blue, Black, Long sleeve, Plaid; flannel; size extra large

Case reference: 2014043999.CaseDesc: The partial cranium belonging to an adult male was found in 2013 in a wooded area north of Terrace, British Columbia. It is likely he was of Asian or Indigenous descent and appears to have sustained a significant facial injury in his lifetime. It is believed he was deceased for several years prior to his cranium being recovered.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Nose, Possible healed fracture of nose - Maxilla

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2014003613.CaseDesc: Larry Mattis was last seen when he was taken to the Edmonton airport by a friend and dropped off for a flight to Toronto.

Case reference: 2014004058.CaseDesc: On January 11, 2001, Yvan Martellino was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Yvan was baptized in the name of Joseph Pierre Raymond Lussier. He studied communication and accounting. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000040.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2002, Bruce Forbes was seen for the last time at a Regent Road residence in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Mr. Forbes suffered from a serious health condition, and required medication on a daily basis. It is believed that Mr. Forbes was not in possession of this medication at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2017013186.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2017, Cameron Duffy was seen for the last time near the Rainbow Bridge in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Hood trimmed with fur

Case reference: 2013000077.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1986, Michael Semergian was seen for the last time in the Outremont District in Montreal, Quebec. Michael has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005499.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of Friday, October 1st, 2010, Janice Cher Desjarlais and her boyfriend crawled into a dumpster located behind The Center of Hope on Franklin Avenue in Fort McMurray. Janice's boyfriend advised that he left at approximately 7:30 a.m. to go to McDonald’s restaurant. When he returned at around 8:30 a.m., Janice was gone. When he was unable to find her, he suspected that the dumpster may have been emptied during his absence. On October 3rd, video surveillance of the area confirmed that the dumpster had been picked up at 8:22 a.m. on October 1st. It also showed the departure of Janice's boyfriend, but no one else entering or leaving the dumpster. On October 5th, a major excavation of the landfill was started, but by the time the search was completed on October 14th, Janice had not been located.

Case reference: 2014005452.CaseDesc: Mr. Hopkins departed his cabin on Sunday, November 2, 1975, to go fishing on Lake Athapapuskow. When he failed to return three days later he was reported missing to police by a friend. Soon thereafter, on November 6th, Mr. Hopkins' boat was located overturned banging against rocks. Numerous personal items were found on shore around the boat. Despite intensive boat patrols and dragging operations, Mr. Hopkins has not been found. Foul play is not suspected, and it is assumed that Mr. Hopkins drowned.

Case reference: 2020028325.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2020, the body of a man was found on the banks of the Saint-Lawrence River in the area of Notre-Dame-des-Sept-Douleurs, Quebec.

Underwear: Cotton, Black, Fruit of the Loom brand, Boxer style
Sweater: Cotton, Black, T-Shirt, Kirkland brand, size M

Case reference: 2005004499.CaseDesc: On August 31, 1996, the body of an unidentified woman was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist dock. Her appendix is present and she may have stretch marks on her thighs.

Teeth: She has natural teeth with one restoration in her left lower second molar.
Underwear: Plaid, Fruit of the Loom, multi-coloured, plaid panties with a white waistband, size 5
Jeans: Denim, Blue, "Hunt Club" jeans, manufactured by Sears, size 14

Case reference: 2018034585.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2004, at approximately 8:00 am, Stephen Lawrence was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Stephen had said he would be home in a few hours.

Shirt: Blue, Brand: Calvin Klein; long sleeves

Case reference: 2020013833.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2020, Dylan Ehler was seen for the last time as he wandered off in Truro, Nova Scotia. Following his disappearance, Dylan’s rubber boots were discovered in a nearby brook by divers. This brook flows into a river that flows with the Bay of Fundy.

Jacket: Dark Green, Camo with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2014004533.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1985, Jonathan Molina was seen for the last time in a vehicle in the White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, Saskatchewan. The following year, on October 1, 1986, the skeletal remains of Jonathan’s mother and infant sibling were found in close proximity of the vehicle. Searches to find Jonathan have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014001134.CaseDesc: Skeletal remains were discovered on the east side of Haida Gwaii on November 15, 1984. A subsequent autopsy showed that the remains were that of a male, approximately 21 to 50 years of age at time of death. Believed to be right handed and dentally conscious having received good treatment. Found with the remains was a tobacco pipe as well as a 2.5 inch tall oriental figurine. The deceased was also in possession of a Gruen Wristwatch.

Jacket: Nylon, Grey, "Jones Tent And Awning" Parka liner
Backpack: Cloth, Dark Blue, Grey, Eddie Bauer

Case reference: 2017073538.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2016, an unidentified man was located at Lake Huron Beach, north of Nine Mile River in Goderich, Ontario. The man previously identified himself as Mitchell Nelson. He travelled extensively by bicycle, and was believed to be from Alberta.

Case reference: 2022018770.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2022, a female child between the age of 4 to 7 years old was discovered at 25 Dale Avenue, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004872.CaseDesc: Andre Lemieux was last seen on January 9, 2007 in Montreal. He brought his child to daycare and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2005000199.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2005, an unidentified man was discovered in a wooded area in Bruce County in Tobermory, Ontario.

Teeth: Extensive metal and composite resin (white) fillings, but his general dental health was excellent
Jacket: Blue, elastic waist and cuffs; Canada Post logo on left chest
Glasses: Other, Wire frames, prescription, near sightedness
Other: hunting knife with a black plastic handle and the initials "EH" engraved on the end of the handle
Vest: Blue, size 3XL; with a Canada Post logo.

Case reference: 2020008549.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1976, at approximately 12:30pm, Licelia D’Costa was last seen by her landlady in Toronto, Ontario. Licelia had told her roommate that she was headed to Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005633.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2011, Dillon Mcmaster had been swimming in the Bow River in Alberta with a group of friends. Dillon was caught in a current, pulled under and was not seen again. Multiple efforts to locate Dillon were negative and he is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014002267.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1992, Pawel Gazdzicki was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Pawel was despondent, suffered from mental health issues, and may have lost his memory. He had mentioned wanting to jump off of the Champlain Bridge.

Case reference: 2012020158.CaseDesc: This adult male was witnessed collapsing in the 400 block of Powell Street in East Vancouver. He was pronounced dead upon arrival to hospital.

Case reference: 2018062802.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2000, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Yao Lin was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001078.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1991, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 30-49 was found in the Louisbourg Park in the Cartierville district of Montreal, Quebec.  The man's face was severely disfigured. A forensic artist has completed a facial reconstruction of his features.

Case reference: 2006000599.CaseDesc:
On May 12, 1988, this Caucasian male was a passenger on a motorcycle involved in a motor vehicle accident. His post-mortem height was recorded as being, approximately 5’7"-5’8" however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. 
He is described as well-nourished. He has rough, calloused hands with oil or grease under his fingernails.

Hair: Brown, Collar length hair, thin moustache
Teeth: Severe crowding of lower incisors and an amalgam restoration in each first molars with the exception of the upper left
Boots: Brown, Western boots, tan coloured leather with worn heels, "Modella" Brand, size 9 1/2-D
Socks: White sport socks with blue and green stripes
Chain: Gold, Chain, gold triangular loop charm with a "Playboy Bunny" in the center.
Underwear: Black bikini style underwear, size L
Shirt: Black t-shirt with a "Jack Daniels" logo, size XL
Jeans: Denim, Blue, "Great Western Garment Company" brand jeans, size 36" waist and 30" inseam
Mark: Dark mole on the side of his left knee.
Scar: Scar in his right groin area, possibly from a hernia repair.

Case reference: 2014005430.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2010, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Isaiah Lai was last seen attending church in Toronto, Ontario. Isaiah was visiting Canada on a student visa.

Case reference: 2005003599.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2002, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem length was 5’5" and his weight was 114lbs., however, due to the condition of the body, this is an underestimate and he weighed more in life. It is estimated that he was in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: Has an amalgam filling on his left lower first molar and poor dental hygiene

Case reference: 2020007777.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1972, at approximately 3:30 am, Dina Kriba was last seen near 843 Danforth Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019013046.CaseDesc: In August 2018, Celia Maria Da Silva was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020011793.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1985, Ruth Koenig was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ruth had taken some time off from working following the death of her husband on October 18, but never returned.

Case reference: 2020040979.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2020, François Danford-Dussault was seen for the last time by his family in Gatineau, Quebec. François is known to be a solitary man who speaks French and English and travels by foot or bicycle. It is believed he may have travelled to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2018041669.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2003, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Yunerkis Cervantes-Estrada was seen for the last time at her residence in Toronto, Ontario. On the following day, Yunerkis left a note at her house which indicated that she was going to a party.

Case reference: 2020011631.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1975, at approximately 8:30 am, Simon Wilson was seen for the last time as he left his home for school in Toronto, Ontario. Simon did not arrive at school.

Case reference: 2014003365.CaseDesc: At approximately 2:00 p.m. on October 30, 1982, Daniel Christensen left the family cabin in the area of Long Lake, Manitoba. He left with the family dog and his intention was to go chicken hunting. His family reported him missing the next day.  On November 6, 1982, the family dog returned to the cabin in good health. Mr. Christensen has never been located.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2016066676.CaseDesc:
Between August 6th and August 13th, 1969, several body parts, believed to belong to the same male individual, were recovered from the water around the Ontario Hydro Forebay, Niagara Falls.
His eyes are brown with very prominent arcus senilis (ring-shaped grayish-white deposit near the peripheral edge of the cornea). His appendix and gall bladder are present. This individual was estimated to have been in the water for at least a few days to a week prior to recovery.

Hair: Grey, White, Facial hair a few days growth in length
Teeth: 1 post. tooth in upper jaw; few missing lower jaw. Teeth: dirty, carious & marked periodontitis. No evidence of dental work

Case reference: 2017041321.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2017, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Dennis Tuyshime was seen for the last time in Québec City, Québec.

Case reference: 2020007935.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1981, at approximately 4:30 pm, Everett Comer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Everett was scheduled to work, but did not show for his shift.

Suit: Blue, Uniform, "Extendicare" uniform with the word "Lyle" on the front pocket

Case reference: 2014006534.CaseDesc: In May of 1967, Donald Lariviere was seen for the last time at the Pinehouse airstrip in Pinehouse, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, Donald was accompanied by his father, who was sleeping at this time. When his father awakened, Donald was gone.
